intro: Peristrophe salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf peristrophe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, willow-like leaves that are opposite and lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with two-lipped corollas, typically in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
